p: In leveraging the largest genotyped case-control AD dataset, this study demonstrates that the current scale of data has reached a threshold where ML can achieve similar predictive accuracy to classical methods and uncover novel genetic insights into AD. Gradient boosting, neural networks, and multifactor dimensionality reduction were selected due to their prominence in the field, demonstrated performance, and complementary strengths. These methods offer distinct advantages: highly performant tree ensembles (GBMs), flexible networks incorporating prior knowledge (NNs), and detection of SNP-SNP interactions (MB-MDR)26. Here they were applied to identify novel genes not detectable via GWAS, and to compare ML prediction accuracies with PRS.
